value.title: Setting default values using COALESCE in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to get default values using the DAX COALESCE function instead of IF statements. A great way to avoid BLANK in Power BI! value.title: Age Banding in Power BI Using TREATAS DAX Function   Relationship Based on Between
value.excerpt: One of the most common types of banding or binning is banding based on a range. Let's say, for example,¬† you want to have a group of customers based on their age group. The age group banding can be created in Power Query at the data transformation stage. It can be created using the Grouping and Binning

value.title: Calculating Stock on Hand Using DAX   Power BI Inventory Model
value.excerpt: You don't have always the luxury of having a snapshot fact table that has the stock on hand value for every single day, at every single workshop, and for every single product. Even if you want to build such a table, it can get easily gigantic. In this video, I am going to show you how you can use DAX

value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.

value.title: Dynamic Banding or Grouping in Power BI   Using DAX Measures   Choose the Count of Bins
value.excerpt: Banding (or binning or grouping) is a scenario that can be implemented both statically and dynamically in Power BI. Dynamic banding means selecting the bin (or band) configuration, and the banding changes based on the user selection of the slicer. Imagine that we have a count of customers by their age

value.title: Find a Text Term in a Field in Power BI Using DAX Functions
value.excerpt: In Power BI, there are multiple ways of searching for a text term inside a text field, you can use Power Query for doing this operation or calculations in DAX. value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you‚Äôll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluate measure formulas. You‚Äôll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. Additionally, you‚Äôll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.

value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you‚Äôll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.
